txt.en: Speak with Mizâdi in Urmâkh.
You see the scouts, their bodies beginning to bloat in the marsh
Crown of Hamât - Fog and Rumours

'They are dead? I dreaded this moment, but it is still worse than I had feared. They were good soldiers, and better people. I will mourn them. We will double up our patrols for now. There is something dangerous about.\n\n'The banner? No, I have never seen something like that before. You should report this straight away to Mizâdi.'

'Yes, this is the outcome I feared to be true. Still, I appreciate the news, grim as it is.

'Thank you for bringing these to me. I fear there is some new group of fiends harassing our southern border.

'This banner? I have not seen it before. Strange. It is quite similar to my own banner. The lion... I wonder. No matter. If they are attacking my scouts, they are no friend of ours. We have quite enough to worry about with Okhíso in Kûr Anzar, but I will think on this more. Thank you, friend.'
Find the second clue as to the scouts' death
Collect the strange banner.
Find a third clue as to the scouts' death
Speak with Mizâdi in Urmâkh
Bring the clues and banner to Mizâdi in Urmâkh.

'Mizâdi said she was sending her best. That is you, I assume? I am heartened. I fear that we will find some danger out here. This is where we all were supposed to meet. I dared not investigate further south, for fear of not coming back myself. I am not worth much in a fight, I'm afraid.\n\n'Would you explore to the south-east near Zahûmakh, the marsh, and see what you find?'
A pile of armour, burned and discarded
Examine the strange banner nearby
Collect the strange banner

'Surâsh, one of my scouts, has returned to me with a harrowing report from southern Imhûlar. The rest of her scouting party has gone missing, and haven't reconvened in a fortnight. She fears the worst. I am duty bound to stay here and defend Urmâkh from Okhíso and his Barkhûshim in Kûr Anzar, but I wish to ease her fears and deliver a resolution to these disappearances.\n\n'Would you investigate these rumours with Surâsh? She can be found near the swamps of Zahûmakh, in southern Imhûlar. I will mark the location on your map. I would consider it a personal favour, [placeholder].'
This scout met a violent end; his armour gouged in deep, curved cuts
This scout did not see her death coming; the back of her neck is caked in dried blood
Speak with Surâsh in southern Imhûlar
This scout fought valiantly, but his wounds are numerous, his chest punctured with arrow heads
Find a third clue as to the scouts' death
Mizâdi requests your aid in investigating a strange and disturbing report she has received from her scouts in the south of Imhûlar.
Examine the scouts for clues of the cause of their untimely end.
A discarded sword, in the style of the Subuzûri guard
Speak with Surâsh at the site of the missing scouts. The site can be found south-east of Urmâkh, near Zahûmakh.
Examine the first scout
Bring the clues and banner to Mizâdi in Urmâkh
Scout the area around Zahûmakh to the south-east where the scouts were last seen.
Examine the second scout
Examine the area around the scouts for more clues as to their demise, and their assailants.
Examine the third scout
Find the first clue as to the scouts' death
A scroll detailing movements of a group of Ordâkhai under a new banner, a silver lion
Speak with Surâsh in southern Imhûlar
Scout the area south-east near Zahûmakh for signs of the scouts
Find the second clue as to the scouts' death
Examine the strange banner near the scouts.
Speak with Surâsh in southern Imhûlar.
A pile of armour, burned and discarded
A scroll detailing movements of a group of Ordâkhai under a new banner, a silver lion
A perplexing banner with a silver lion's head, similar in image to Mizâdi's standard

'Yes, this is the outcome I feared to be true. Still, I appreciate the news, grim as it is. \n\n'This banner? I have not seen it before. Strange. It is quite similar to my own banner. The lion... I wonder. No matter. If they are attacking my scouts, they are no friend of ours. We have quite enough to worry about with Okhíso in Kûr Anzar, but I will think on this more. Thank you, friend.'
